headline.main: Weight Training May Lower Diabetes Risk

docs.abstract: In a study, doing at least two and a half hours a week of either aerobic exercise or weight training substantially lowered the risk of Type 2 diabetes -- but doing both may offer the greatest benefit.
docs.snippet: In a study, doing at least two and a half hours a week of either aerobic exercise or weight training substantially lowered the risk of Type 2 diabetes -- but doing both may offer the greatest benefit.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sophisticated flavors and textures that this dish offers may convert those who think they don’t like leeks.

docs.lead_paragraph: A free-speech lawsuit is challenging North Carolina’s complaint that a blogger is giving illegal counseling.

headline.seo: Nutrition Blogger Fights North Carolina Licensing Rebuke
headline.main: Blogger Giving Advice Resists State’s: Get a License
headline.print_headline: Blogger Who Gives Advice Resists a State’s: Get a License

docs.abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column on free-speech lawsuit filed by blogger Steve Cooksey, who is challenging North Carolina's complaint that he was giving illegal nutritional counseling on his Web site; case highlights the collision between power of government to license and regulate those pursuing a profession and the freedom of speech guaranteed by the First Amendment.
docs.snippet: A free-speech lawsuit is challenging North Carolina’s complaint that a blogger is giving illegal counseling.

docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure to reduce sodium and saturated fats in American diets, the cheese industry has tried, with little success, to make products with less salt or fat that consumers will like.

headline.seo: U.S. Cheese Industry Works to Reduce Sodium and Fat
headline.main: Asked to Get Slim, Cheese Resists
headline.print_headline: Asked To Get Slim, Cheese Resists

docs.abstract: American cheese industry, under pressure to reduce the consumption of sodium and saturated fats, has had little success in producing healthier products that consumers will still enjoy (Series: What We Eat).
docs.snippet: Under pressure to reduce sodium and saturated fats in American diets, the cheese industry has tried, with little success, to make products with less salt or fat that consumers will like.

docs.lead_paragraph: When his mother's kidneys began to fail three years ago, Ed Guillen knew what he had to do: donate one of his kidneys to her. But Mr. Guillen received a shock during a phone call with the Stanford Kidney Transplant Clinic, where his mother was being treated. He was ineligible to be a donor, even before tests to see if he was a genetic match.At 5-foot-10 and around 280 pounds, Mr. Guillen, a 39-year-old software developer in Redmond, Wash., was considered too heavy to donate an organ without potentially endangering his own health. He would need to lose more than 70 pounds, he was told, before the clinic would consider him as a candidate.

headline.main: Transplant Centers Struggle With Donors' Obesity

docs.abstract: Growing number of potential organ donors are ineligible to donate because of excessive weight, yet another unexpected consequence to America's growing obesity problem; overweight donors run a risk of endangering their own health. Photo (M)t
docs.snippet: When his mother's kidneys began to fail three years ago, Ed Guillen knew what he had to do: donate one of his kidneys to her. But Mr. Guillen received a shock during a phone call with the Stanford Kidney Transplant Clinic, where his mother was being...

headline.main: Transplant Centers Struggle With Donors' Obesity
headline.print_headline: Transplant Centers Struggle With Donors’ Obesity

docs.abstract: Add one more unexpected consequence of Americans' expanding waistlines: A growing number of potential organ donors are ineligible to donate because of their weight.
docs.snippet: Add one more unexpected consequence of Americans' expanding waistlines: A growing number of potential organ donors are ineligible to donate because of their weight.

docs.lead_paragraph: The south of France lures a group of friends back again and again, but dishes celebrating the region’s summer produce can be replicated almost anywhere. Today: a grain salad with tomatoes, broad green beans and a tangy dressing.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a new advertising and sweepstakes campaign, Lunchables will give away prizes valued at more than $1 million to children, but critics question the nutritional component.

headline.seo: Lunchables Ads Promote a Sweepstakes for Children
headline.main: A Torrent of Toys, From Lunchables
headline.print_headline: A Torrent of Toys, From Lunchables

docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column notes Kraft's Lunchables, in a new ad and sweepstakes campaign, will give away prizes valued at more than $1 million to children, but critics question the nutritional component.
docs.snippet: In a new advertising and sweepstakes campaign, Lunchables will give away prizes valued at more than $1 million to children, but critics question the nutritional component.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations World Food Program will send corn to the country, where thousands have been displaced and large areas of farmland washed away.

headline.seo: Emergency Food Aid for North Korea After Severe Floods
headline.main: North Korea to Receive Aid After Floods
headline.print_headline: North Korea To Receive Aid After Floods

docs.abstract: United Nations World Food Program says it will send a first batch of emergency food aid to impoverished North Korea, where a typhoon and floods have left hundreds of people dead or missing.
docs.snippet: The United Nations World Food Program will send corn to the country, where thousands have been displaced and large areas of farmland washed away.
